player: Dwight Howard is resting Monday vs. the Knicks.
DeAndre Bembry (personal) will not play on Monday vs. the Hawks.
Mike Muscala (left ankle) won't travel for Monday's game vs. the Knicks.
Tiago Splitter (calf) will not play Tuesday vs. the Nets.
Brook Lopez (rest) will not suit up for Sunday's game against the Rockets.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) will not play on Sunday against the Rockets.
Kelly Olynyk (ankle) and Avery Bradley (Achilles) will play Monday vs. the Hornets.
James Young (ankle) will not practice on Sunday.
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Hornets.
Jeremy Lamb (foot) will not play on Monday vs. Boston.
Dwyane Wade (rest) will not play against the Grizzlies on Sunday.
Coach Fred Hoiberg is "hopeful" that Nikola Mirotic (illness) will play on Tuesday against Dallas.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
Andrew Bogut (hamstring) will be out for "the near future," according to coach Rick Carlisle.
Gary Harris (right ankle sprain) will not return to Monday's game against the Magic.
Darrell Arthur (knee) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Magic.
Michael Gbinije (right forearm bruise) is listed as doubtful for Friday's game vs. Utah.
Kentavious Caldwell-Pope (shoulder) has been ruled out for Sunday's game against the Lakers.
Jon Leuer (knee) won't play vs. the Lakers on Sunday.
Clint Capela (leg) could return on Tuesday vs. the Heat or Wednesday vs. the Bucks.
Rodney Stuckey (hamstring) will miss at least the next four games for the Pacers.
Blake Griffin (knee) ran light sprints along the sideline at Staples Center during warm-ups on Saturday.
Brice Johnson (back) is now able to play 1-on-1 and is nearing a return to true on-court activities according to coach Doc Rivers.
Jordan Clarkson (sprained right ankle) and Tarik Black (sprained left ankle) are being listed as questionable for Tuesday's game against the Nuggets.
Larry Nance (knee) played 1-on-1 against Ivica Zubac on Saturday.
Deyonta Davis (foot) will be active and available to play Wednesday vs. the Thunder.
Brandan Wright (left ankle) has started full-speed individual workouts and hopes to make his season debut in January.
Willie Reed (bruised sternum) is probable for Tuesday's game vs. the Rockets.
Josh Richardson (foot) will miss at least the next two weeks of action.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) had surgery to repair a torn labrum on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Anthony Davis (right hip, left thumb) is doubtful to return to Monday's game against the Pacers.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Lance Thomas (left orbital fracture) will not play on Monday vs. the Hawks.
Updating a previous report, Kristaps Porzingis (Achilles) will not play on Monday vs. the Hawks.
Steven Adams has been diagnosed with a concussion and he will not play Monday vs. the Clippers.
Evan Fournier (heel) will not suit up for Monday's game against the Nuggets, as expected.
Nerlens Noel (sprained left ankle) will not play Monday vs. the Bucks.
T.J. McConnell (wrist) is currently without an official timetable to return.
Richaun Holmes will not play on Saturday against the Wizards.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
Ben Simmons (foot) played point guard during some 5-on-0 drills at Tuesday's practice.
Brandon Knight showed up on the box score as a "DNP-sprained right wrist" on Saturday.
Ed Davis (sprained left ankle) is available to play on Monday vs. the Wizards.
Festus Ezeli (knee) will not be with the Blazers on their four-game trip, but his agent says it is
because of an impending knee surgery.
Patty Mills (left calf tightness) said that he's planning on playing vs. the Wolves on Tuesday.
Dejounte Murray (sprained right ankle) has been ruled out for Tuesday's game against the Timberwolves.
Ty Lawson (ankle) twisted his left ankle and will miss the remainder of Sunday's game against the Thunder.
Patrick Patterson (sore left knee) will not play Sunday vs. the Knicks.
Delon Wright (shoulder) has been cleared for team practice.
Jared Sullinger (foot) said he won't set a return date despite being cleared for practice.
Rodney Hood (knee) was diagnosed with a right knee bone bruise and hyperextension after having an MRI on Sunday morning.
Joe Johnson (rest) will not play on Saturday against the Magic.
Scott Brooks said that Ian Mahinmi (knees) will be re-evaluated at the end of January.
Danuel House (fractured right wrist) will be re-evaluated in 10 days.
